Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff not so great”
Reviews.Author: PetarStefanovic
Reviews.Content: Pro: Hotel is set in excellent location, very near the Taksim Square. Rooms and facilities look nice, above standard for hotel of that type in Turkey. Our favorite parts were excellent indoor and outdoor pool. A word of warning: please note that you have to wear swimming cap for the indoor pool. If you don't have one - you have to buy it (although the stated price is 5 TL, they charged us 9 TL?!) in the spa area. Breakfast is pretty standard for Turkey, buffet without pork, but with some excellent dairy products. Contra: The staff was inadequate for a hotel of this standard. First when we came to check in, they gave us a stuffy and dark "smoking allowed" room, even though we specifically asked for a non smoking one. It took them 25 minutes to find us a substitute room and when they did - it was one class lower then the one that we paid for. At least it was a non-smoking, so we accepted it. Later, we found a hotel's "pillow menu" (they pride in having this), but when we asked for a latex pillow from that same menu we haven't received anything for half an hour). Then after calling again, a man came - bearing the same (ordinary) pillow that we already had. So we called again and explicitly explained what we want. They said OK and there was a dÃ©jÃ  vu - same guy came with another pillow of the same kind. We kept calling and trying to explain, but with the same result. Long story short - they kept bringing us ordinary pillows every time, so by the end of the evening we ended up with 8 pillows. Don't get me wrong - we're not snobs, and the point was not in the latex pillows, but in the facts that if you offer something very clearly, in printed menu, in every room - your employees should at least know something about it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent stay, But....”
Reviews.Author: Zaina F
Reviews.Content: Clean, good Located, Small Rooms, very Small Bathrooms, un-isolated rooms we could hear every thing on the next rooms even the small sounds, even the smoking smell was inside our room Most of the staff are very nice and helpful but one of the recepcienist guy (night shift is really rude and not helpful at all, and this should be taken into the manager consideration) as it will affect on the hotel Breakfast Menu was low class and shouldnt be rated as 4 stars delux hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms and Slow service but good location”
Reviews.Author: Ali H
Reviews.Content: It was a trip for our honeymoon in Istanbul and we spent around a week in 3 different hotels and the Taksim Gonen was one of them. We checked in twice to the hotel and they were facing some difficulties in electrical power. However, they gave us the smallest room in the hotel. It had teh basic functions but the Tv was not working and teh service was very slow in general, We requested Bath Robes but we were not given any but in general the reception ladies were friendly and helped us a lot. Our room was changed when we returned to the hotel after leaving to Bursa and it was a much better one. The food was not that good but it was satisfactory. the best thing about this hotel is the location of course and if it is compared to neighbouring hotels I dont think that the difference will be high but certainly there are 2 or 3 hotels in the same area with maybe 10$ difference in rate who can be better in terms of service

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Value, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: chibucky
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a much nicer interior than the website shows, but, unfortunately, when we went in late September the rooftop restaurant wasn't open. I'm not sure if that was a function of it no longer being high season or if the restaurant is just not open except for special occasions, but we were disappointed, as that was one of the reasons that we picked the hotel. Additionally, we had to wait for almost an hour for the hotel shuttle to pick us up from the airport, and call the hotel twice from the phone at the post office at Ataturk Airport. It was a pretty inconvenient and stressful process altogether - might be better to just get your own cab. The hotel was right off Taksim Square, easy walking distance from the bus and metro systems. Also very close to Istiklal caddesi - which is a pretty vibrant area at night. Hotel was quiet for sleeping, however. Additionally, the room was stocked with water and fruit, which was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: fullerabent
Reviews.Content: A good sized room. clean and rather nice. The breakfast buffet was good, however, the dining upstairs was not adequate for vegetarian diets. But the location was great, lots of shopping and restaurants near by. Overall a great location and a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable if you get a special rate”
Reviews.Author: FoodieScotland
Reviews.Content: Located in an interesting part of town with easy access to many of the city's sights. My room was quiet enough though small and the air conditioning worked, but the bed was not very comfortable. The tiny elevators are inadequate to cope with the number of guests and this is a problem if you are on a high floor. Buffet breakfast is very good with plenty of choice. The free wifi was unreliable. There are two pools, one on the roof which has great views over the city. Overall perfectly acceptable if you get a special rate. It's worth negotiating as there's lots of competition in the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN, PLEASANT HOTEL, GR8 BREAKFAST, FRIENDLY STAFF”
Reviews.Author: Sumaya_laher
Reviews.Content: Given what we had read `on the net we did not know what to expect but the room was terrific (remember all rooms in Istanbul are generally small) but this was one of the better rooms. Clean bathroom, good cleaning services, excellent breakfast, internet superfast and free wifi. Staff at the front desk (black uniforms) really helpful. Some weird pool policies which are not the most kiddy friendly and that was our only drawback. we chose the hotel because of the indoor and outdoor pool but our kids were not comfortable with the adult atmosphere in the spa where the indoor pool was located. If you do go to the hotel, make sure you take a swimcap for use in the indoor pool and that u take proper swimwear. We introduced them to the concept of a rush vest and pants so that's now acceptable. Sometimes loud music @ nght from restaurant upstairs but didn't disturb us much

Reviews.Title: “Next time I'll try some where else!”
Reviews.Author: poosad
Reviews.Content: first thing impacts you is a very tiny room which you can't move, even if you want to open the fridge you need to move the bed. location is good by the way though too busy and crowd. staff are not so helpful and most of them does not know any language except Turkish. indoor pool is more like cemetery how ever the roof pool should be better (we did not try that since we were busy and it was NOT for FREE). breakfast is basic, and we did not dare to try other meals ;), Next time I'll try some where else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: SweetJoudy
Reviews.Content: Very gentle and helpful staff, especially reception, bell boys and people at the inside pool. Maybe the mini-bar guy, cleaning ladies and people at breakfast should try start smiling a bit more. Location is really good, close to everything and easy access to each kind of transportation. We are a couple 35 years old, visiting for an orthodox baptism and we booked a double room, but we got a spacious triple room. No noise at all from the road when the windows were closed. Cleaning ladies were a bit noisy in the morning but nothing to serious and walls are thin enough to listen next door babies, but still nothing to annoying. The a/c was super. Bathroom was clean and spacious, with new supplies every day and clean towels too. We got a basket of fruits as a welcome gift. But the best of all was the free airport transfer, very useful, especially for first time visitors. Breakfast was good with many local tastes and a good variety. We would stay here again for sure. We would stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “nice trip”
Reviews.Author: ibrahimEgypt
Reviews.Content: i really enjoy the time in this hotel . it is very wonderful hotel , good staff , good food , rooms are very good

Reviews.Title: “Short Break in Taksim GÃ¶nen!!”
Reviews.Author: RoozbeH
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this greatly located hotel for three nights for Yasmin Levy's concert. I got to the hogel early in the morning and i couldn't get an early checkin so i had to wander around the hotel after a sleepless night,a bit of discomfort. Pros: location,service,breakfast,Spa and indoor pool Cons: thin walls - snoring neighbour made sleeping really hard-rooms were surely smaller thN a 4 star hotel (i have been to other 4-star hotels in the area and they were surely better).

Reviews.Title: “amazing trip”
Reviews.Author: zoubir92
Reviews.Content: I have just came back from Istambul, an amazing town with a very nice people; Those that I met in the Gonen Taksim hotel ( staff) were nice, very helpfull, and always smiling, I would say thanks for every one and a special thanks for Pinar allias sweet water who works in the gym club and who was as well as helpfull and always and always smiling

Reviews.Title: “New decor, great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Jampal32
Reviews.Content: We were quite nervous about this hotel having read some of the reviews here, but it seems the place has been renovated fairly recently. The staff were friendly and helpful - over attentive in the restaurant and cafe in fairness. The food in the roof top restaurant was excellent and our meal was only spoiled by the overpriced, rather bad Turkish wine (a common problem in Turkey, they don't like to import things much). The rooms are modern, with good facilities and very clean. My only complaint is that due to the excellent location there is a lot of noise from the ever busy traffic (Car horns, nonstop, 3:30am, till 3:30am, nonstop!!) , even from my room on the 7th floor, the noise from outside was a bit much. Closing the window helped but the Air Con unit in the room was noisy and didn't really ventilate too well. All up, I would stay there again. They need to sort the AC units, clean the filters, oil the fans etc. And they need a choice of pillows. The location for evenings out and shopping are excellent. Also Taksim sq is the main hub for public transport so getting around this sprawling great City is easy from here. You wonâ€™t be bored of an evening. I paid Â£89.00 for a double room, which was reasonable value I think. Oh and Breakfast was quite good too.

Reviews.Title: “a good one”
Reviews.Author: perhane
Reviews.Content: i stayed there a few years ago, in a comfortable and modern room. i had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Four Stars Hotel but five Stars Value”
Reviews.Author: Adonia2010
Reviews.Content: Just back from a three days buisness trip to Istanbul. This was my second stay in Taksim Gonen Hotel. The first one was 2007. I must say that the hotel managment did something remarkable in these last three years. Although I already liked it in the first time, but in this second trip I was surprised from the positive development they did. The staff is friendly and the Buffet Breakfast is not extremely rich but it hits different tastes. The location is really very practical for those of you that will be picked up by someone. Somehow you can say that it's quite although that In less than 1 minutem you'll find your self at Taksim and thats a big plus point.

Reviews.Title: “OOPS”
Reviews.Author: Yas007
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was really good and the view of our room(10th floor)but the sound of the resturant was too loud,the carpet was not clean,you cant find any smile on the face of the people who work on the resturant for breakfast ,our room was very small ,our baby bed was broken ,...

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: travellerfr0mCrete
Reviews.Content: Very central,one minute from Taksim Squre in a lively and safe area with several nice restaurents around.Very helpfull staff,with adequate knowledge of English,,Modern comfortable rooms,great breakfast both on variety and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: Rayhan_10
Reviews.Content: Reading some of the previous reviews, I was rather doubtful about this hotel; however, when I arrived, I found everything better than what I expected: polite staff, very clean rooms, digital safe box in the room, nice furniture, nice breakfast, free laptop and internet at the lobby, great location (very close to Taksim square and Istiklal road). The only negative point was that our room was overlooking a very ugly old building at the back of the hotel and also jacuzzi in the bath didn't work! All in all, I will go back to Taksim Gonen hotel the next time I go to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough”
Reviews.Author: Rammin
Reviews.Content: I was in turkey four times but first time in Istanbul for metal concert, Sonisphere Rock festival. The concert run for 3 days and it was in inuno stadium near taksim square so I decide to book a hotel at taksim area. Location of the hotel was very good, very close to taksim square and station of many buses and taxies is taksim square. Also the area is very beautiful and pleasant for walking specially the Istiklal road which is a long walking street full of brands, shops, restaurants and bars. The hotel itself is in very good location but it is a small hotel with small sized rooms but very clean with good breakfast. Also it has small roof top pool with very pleasant view and indoor pool and gym.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT IN ANY WAY!!”
Reviews.Author: CHRISAth
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 days,in this central but very convinient hotel!!The staff was over our expectations,helpful,kind.The staff at the lobby always with a big smile ready to help us,the service at the restaurants was great!!A big and tastefull breakfast every day!!the rooms very clean and there was enough space for 3 people to get around.All though the weather was against us,we had a great time!!Really a magical place Istanbul took our hearts and minds!!Thank you Taksim gonen staff for your smile every day.

Reviews.Title: “Small but decent”
Reviews.Author: BigBasil
Reviews.Content: Very small, but nice room. The problem was that there was a locked door, and the smoke from the cigarettes of the nearby residents, (as well as the noise), passed through... When complained to the reception, they proposed to us to change room, rather than advise the residents of the next room...(!). On the other hand, the staff was kind and willing to give instructions regarding the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Hayat1965
Reviews.Content: Great location very near to Taksim Square and the Metro Station which connects to Sishani in one and Sisli & Levent (Canyon & Metro City Shopping Centre) in the other direction. Taxis to go to other places are always available in that city area. Lots of small shops & restaurants around the hotel. * Friendly staff at the reception with good command of English. * Small but clean room including bathroom. Triple room is not really meant for three grown-ups with three suitcases. Plenty of aminities (Shower gel, shampoo, hair conditioner). Nice shower. Great water pressure. * Some view of the Bosphorus and the first bridge on the 9th floor. * Free Wifi in the rooms with excellent connectivity! Other hotels take up to 29 Euro/day! * Good breakfast even compared with a 5* Hotel like the Moevenpick in which I had to pay an extra 28 Euro for the breakfast! The breakfast room is downwstairs which is really a pity. The staff was friendly & the service was efficient. The qualtiy of the food was pretty good. Bread & pastry were fresh! * In room service was delivered within 20 minutes and the food was pretty good & tasty. Staff was again friendly and spoke English. Prices are absolutely affordable. A salad is 4.50-5.00 Euro, which can not be found easily in other hotels. A good choice for parents who can not go to the restaurant in the evening. All in all good value for money! I did not expect a lot after having read some comments on this hotel but having spent two nights at this hotel and having compared it to other hotels in Istanbul which are much more expensive I must say that I will definitely consider this hotel again for my next visit. No luxury! No fuss! Just a good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in great area”
Reviews.Author: frinky
Reviews.Content: Okay so not a 4* by western standards and the reception staff are quite rude who don't greet you in anyway, but the rooms are clean, layout is good all modcons. Breakfast is pleasant, typical continental although not much fresh fruit which is a shame as lots on the markets. Coffee fresh and waiting staff fine when you eventually catch their eye. Area is great very safe and isitikal road great for shopping and food. Pool top very nice and empty when we went. The 'falafel house' and pastry shop behind the hotel 'mohammed siad' are very good, nice and friendly staff there! It was expensive but then all hotels in istanbul are. Overall a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, centrally located hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MonsieurPeche
Reviews.Content: The hotel is literally 100m from Taksim Square and is very convenient for exploration of Istanbul. I would agree with some of the other reviewers that in fairness it should be a 3 star. The reception and lobby is clean, the staff very helpful, especially the concierge who went out of his way to sort cabs and try to help us with maps and useful information. Rooms were clean and functional, restaurant satisfactory. The rooms have little to no view, but the hotel has a rooftop swimming pool and bar, which proved a big hit with all of us. I would stay here again if returning to Istanbul, as is fine for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “very good location”
Reviews.Author: a74
Reviews.Content: in the middle of the Istanbul center, renovated, friendly atmosphere... there is also free turkish bath, gym, indoor and outdoor pool...and a nice terrace bar...

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice and practical”
Reviews.Author: shtronix
Reviews.Content: Good location in a safety street near taksim square and Istiklal street. Clean hotel and rooms, nice design. internet WIFI in all rooms. open buffÃ© for breakfast in a nice restaurant. roof restaurant and swimming pool with bosphorus view. clean indoor swimming pool with jaccusi and sauna . turkish Hammam and sport room. BUT: small room ( specially for double room), thin wall between rooms. poor english language for staff ( exept reception) like all turkish people in the street and shops. Overall: good choice for some days, cheap price. specially for tourism when you spend all the day outside in Istanbul. i think this is a three stars hotel not four and all hotels ( exept the 5 stars) in taksim area have small rooms and not better than Taksim Gonen hotel

Reviews.Title: “Gay freindly? - not really!”
Reviews.Author: LEONARDO-2323
Reviews.Content: The hotel is listed as 'gay friendly' - but if you are gay and thinking of visitng Istanbul - think again! The rooms were VERY clean and actually quite good in terms of decor but the icy reception staff left us in no doubt that we were (just) 'tolerated' rather than welcome. If you are into the 'gay' areas of the city this hotel is well located but do your homework on the internet before you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “There are better choices than this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pris11
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a visit to Istanbul, a three-night in this hotel seemed a lot Langer. The hotel location is good, and the breakfast buffet is very good. The hotel is rated four stars, it should not be more than three. The air conditioned does not work, the weather outside was nicer than the inside the rooms that felt like a sauna. No use in complaining, nothing was done. The rooms are good, if a little small, but clean. On our last day, one of the bathroom towels had stains on it, it smelled clean but there were stainsâ€¦ Overall I would say this is an average three star hotel, very good location but the overall service is far from outstanding. Given the situation with the a/c I would not recommend it for summer time.

Reviews.Title: “not worthy”
Reviews.Author: stigma
Reviews.Content: we went to Istanbul to attend our firends wedding ,other friends were staying at Taksim Gonen ,we had no choice but this hotel. I think it is way to expensive for facilities they offer comparing to other non Europian cities for example Cairo, Egypt,, we had great all inclusive 5 night stay at Bodrum so we could tolerate some how. breakfast area is in basement, they have great roof top resturant ,why not serving breakfast there ?? any how rooftop pool is more like bikini show for staf which they all freeze staring at you!!! one way free transfer to airport was the only looking forward event during our stay!! just go for location,,

Reviews.Title: “Warning - don't go!!”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrotter014
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at Taxim Gonen end of April 2008. The hotel seemed ok at first, with a decent lobby and rooms. However, in terms of service and reliability they were terrible. It all started when I exhanged euros for turkish lira at the hotel reception (around 300 lira)- the problem was they gave me a fake 100 bill, which nearly got me into trouble when I tried to spend it, being of course unaware it was fake. When I went back to the reception they denied having given me fake money but in the end they exchanged the fake for a real bill after long negotiations with the manager. And then the real trouble came. We had booked the hotel online and had already paid for our stay when making the reservation. But at check out, they charged us for our stay again! I only realized when I got my credit card bill a month later. I sent several emails to the manager but never got any reply. So we ended up being charged twice for the room. I am never going back to this hotel and would advise everyone to avoid it. Be aware that the locals will always try to trick you so you must be alert at all times! If I went back to Istanbul, I'd rather stay in Sultanahmed area, and avoid taxim completely.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't complain until a neighbour checked in!”
Reviews.Author: BuDavid
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very clean, service is good (even though the spoken english of the employees is very low but it is not a problem for me) the decoration of the rooms and the colors are nice, everything what a room needs is there. I was verysatisfied until a nieghbour in the next room checked in, he got a call while he was in his room, with our TV on I could recognise that he is from egypt! damn those walls are like paper!! I was very disspapointed from that, having walls like that made me feel like being in a the college dorms! it should be rated as 4 star dormitory not a 4 star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: raihan14
Reviews.Content: stayed there for three nights the jacuzii doesn't work, they put a plastic cover over the old bathtub and made it a jacuzi. the reciption staff can't speak english , the breakfast is not fresh, they give the leftovers from the previous day , the rooms are not sound proof you can hear whats going on in the other room and are small no space to walk, only thing that is good is the location

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: HughCyprus
Reviews.Content: The lobby is like a morgue waiting room, my room smelt of urine - 1108. I complained 3 times but no result. The breakfast is like school dinners, enough but tasteless. The location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Woodhouse35
Reviews.Content: Went there for work and stayed two nights. Found reception good, though their communication skills in English sometimes let them down but they did their best and were very helpful. My room was on the tenth floor and it has lovely views over the city. Room was small but comfortably furnished. WC/Shower room was a little too small to be comfortable in and enjoy after a shower. Shower was awkward to use. It advertises a rooftop resturaunt however it wasnt there however you can still enjoy the great views over the city to the sea. Breakfast was a bit disappointing as the selection is more European than UK, so didnt eat much but there is enough that you can find something. Hotel is a good location for shops and I'd maybe stay their again if i was going for work.

HotelInfo.Name: Taksim Gonen Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Aydede Cad No 15 | Taksim, Istanbul 80090, Turkey
